thread.title: Vote: What will break our economic stride? | Jon Talton
thread.title_full: Vote: What will break our economic stride? | Jon Talton | The Seattle Times

author: Jon Talton
title: Vote: What will break our economic stride? | Jon Talton
text:
A new report from Redfin argues that housing sales could see a sharp slowdown . U.S. sales of new houses fell 6.8 percent in June.
Gold prices are in the midst of their biggest rout in two decades; this could be anticipating higher interest rates from the Federal Reserve but also a sign of ongoing deflation worldwide.
Speaking of the Fed, the central bank has accidentally (or, in 1981 deliberately) caused most recessions in the post-World War II era.
China is still shaky, undercutting copper and other commodities (and stoking deflation). The eurozone is still a mess. And inequality at near historic highs is a drag on growth.
Most Read Stories Video from bus driver’s body camera could cost 2 deputies their jobs Donnie Chin, Chinatown ID's 'frontline hero,' killed in early morning shooting Time for Mariners to face reality as trade deadline nears 2 killed in drive-by shooting on I-5 in Mount Vernon Lifestyle changes may guard aging brain against memory loss In Seattle, the economy is vulnerable to overbuilding and a tech bubble. If a new City Council tries to “stick it to the man,” it might also stick it to the local economy.
There’s no shortage of worries in a recovery that has left too many people behind. Over the next six months, what do you think is the biggest concern?
